programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: In Indonesia we find regions where the air is so toxic that it's 40 times above human safe levels and sulphuric acid vents from the ground in dense yellowish clouds. Elsewhere, small volcanoes are so active, they are said to erupt every 15 minutes!

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Japan is going through a seismic crisis after the devastating Tsunami of 2011. We look closely at two very dangerous volcanoes; both are considered to be in the top 5 most dangerous on the planet.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys

programme.sub-title: In the Path of a Volcano

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia makes gas-grilled shrimp skewers with lemon-garlic sauce, a tangy farro salad with white beans and snap peas, plus homemade strawberry frozen yogurt and chocolate shell topping.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia whips up her favorite fried chicken with slow-cooker buttermilk smashed potatoes, and quick collard greens with hot pepper vinegar

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia beats the heat with a light and summery gazpacho, seasoned croutans, a Spanish-inspired meat and cheese board and a fruity summer sangria for a crowd

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia shares her recipe for easy broiled salmon with mustard and crisp dilled crust, orzo salad with cucumber, red onion, and mint, plus a pretty and pink berry fool for dessert

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia's take on comfort food includes thick-cut pork chops with smoked sea salt, garlic-scented mashed sweet potatoes with coconut milk and cilantro, a brussels sprouts and kale salad with herbs and peanuts, and her slow-cooker nutella bread pudding.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia whips up her favorite Bloody Marys with fresh horseradish and homemade cocktail onions plus sheet-pan hash browns for a crowd and springy green Shakshuka.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia resizes Italian classics for families of two or three, starting with a meaty loaf-pan lasagna, crispy artichoke salad with lemon vinaigrette, and a scaled-down version of creamy tiramisu.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia makes roast beef weeknight-friendly with her cast-iron roast beef with gravy, salt-crusted fingerling potatoes, and carrot-noodle salad with homemade harissa and honey.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia makes her favorite weeknight dinner featuring a butterflied and Za'tar rubbed roast chicken with homemade preserved lemons, kale and sweet potato salad with pomegranate vinaigrette, and cozy coconut rice pudding.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia's weekend plans include her favorite cast-iron chicken chilaquiles with homemade hot sauce, refreshing micheladas, and restaurant-inspired fried ice cream cake.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia makes a celebratory dinner inspired by Italy: fresh halibut puttanesca, garlicky broccolini, crispy polenta triangles, and olive-oil yogurt cake for dessert.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia makes quinoa burgers with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and marinated feta, a sweet and red potato salad, followed by a lightened carrot snack care with yogurt frosting.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia plans a date night with Ian featuring herb-crusted beef tenderloin for two, air-fryer cheesy potatoes, marinated tomato salad with arugula and goat cheese, followed by decadent creme brulees for two.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Who doesn't like a plate of good nachos or Buffalo wings? We discover when you can use supermarket products versus when only good, fresh ingredients will do. A simple, sweet-tart sangria finishes our party menu.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Simple yet interesting, both chicken Milanese and chicken piccata are reliable test kitchen favorites. We like to start them on the stovetop but finish the cooking in the oven

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The test kitchen provides foolproof recipes for two classic pasta sauces: puttanesca and Bolognese.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pasta with garlic and oil is perhaps the most famous quick pasta dish. It starts with ingredients on hand—garlic, good olive oil, hot red pepper flakes—and turns them into something special and uncommonly good.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We uncover the secrets to beef Burgundy at its best—and also show you a way to make portions of it ahead of time.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Macaroni and cheese and turkey Tetrazzini are two classic casseroles, but they are rarely as good as they could be. We knew we could do better—much better—in the test kitchen.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: On a hot summer's day, life doesn't get much better than a big, juicy, smoky slab of spicy, mouth-watering ribs. Our goal was to produce flavorful, juicy, tender ribs that would be well worth the time, money, and effort.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Ham dinner—with green bean casserole—is classic American fare. But which kind of ham should you buy? And can you really make a "good" green bean casserole? We show you how.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Our sour cream coffee cake and light, flavorful fruit salads transform weekend brunch into an indulgent meal you'll want to make even when company isn't coming over. A few tips on great coffee round out the perfect start to a day.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The appeal of such quick bread as cinnamon buns and banana bread is clear. Supermarket cinnamon buns often have an odd, artificial flavor and sponge-like texture. And banana bread doesn't need to taste like over-the-hill bananas.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Lemon meringue pie is a three-part recipe—crust, lemon filling, and meringue—and each one can be a challenge. We discover which rolling pins are best and whether you can use store-bought pie crust in a pinch. Then we perfect the filling and meringue.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: A true New York-style cheesecake should be pure and minimalist but also have just the right color, flavor, and density. With a crisp graham cracker crust and a filling that fades from creamy to cake-like, our cheesecake is worthy of any diner in New York.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What's the best way to enjoy summer tomatoes? While it's hard to argue with sliced, salted tomatoes, there are times when you want to use tomatoes in more elaborate dishes, and gazpacho and a cheesy tart are two of our favorites.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Chili is probably America's favorite one-pot supper and we wanted to create a great, simple version. And while no one thinks of a clambake as a one-pot wonder, we set out to make an indoor version simple enough to prepare even on a busy weeknight.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Watch as we figure out the best recipes for two New Orleans favorites—Jambalaya and bananas Foster.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Tomatoes and pasta are a classic (and delicious) pairing, but sometimes you want a change. Vegetable sauces, like the two featured in this episode—one with mushrooms and one with broccoli rabe—are appealing options.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pork producers have worked so hard to remove fat from their pigs that most pork roasts have little character. Glazing a pork roast with maple syrup is an attractive way to boost flavor and we wanted to perfect this recipe.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Truckers often know where to find the best home-style cooking. And what could be better than chicken-fried steak with cream gravy and real coconut cream pie?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Although chicken dinners are quick to prepare, they can go terribly wrong. Part of the problem is the chicken itself—the breast meat has little fat and becomes dry and chalky if overcooked. The other major source of trouble is improper cooking methods.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt hurdles into spectacular new adventures from Rome to Shanghai as he races to rescue a captured agent and stop Davian from eliminating his next target, Ethan’s wife.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Agent Ethan Hunt and his elite team go underground after a bombing implicates them as terrorists. While trying to clear their name, the team uncovers a plot to start a nuclear war.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: Ethan and team take on their most impossible mission yet, eradicating the Syndicate - an International rogue organization as highly skilled as they are, committed to destroying the IMF.

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: In WWII, a group of German officers plots to assassinate Hitler and seize control of the military command to end the war. The operation was codenamed "Valkyrie", for the plan that was meant to be used in case of a revolt against the Nazi government.

programme.title: Rachel Getting Married
programme.desc: When Kym, returns to the Buchman family home for the wedding of her sister Rachel, she brings a long history of personal crises, family conflict, and tragedy along with her. Rated -R

programme.title: Margot at the Wedding
programme.desc: On the eve of her estranged sister Pauline’s wedding to unemployed musician/artist/depressive Malcolm at the family seaside home, Margot shows up to rekindle the sisterly bond and offer her own brand of “support.”

programme.title: MURIEL'S WEDDING
programme.desc: In this perfect marriage of feel-good comedy and heartfelt drama, a shy daydreamer finds the courage to leave on a tropical vacation, where she meets a wacky new friend, changes her name, and turns her world upside down, all to an ABBA soundtrack.

programme.title: East Side Sushi
programme.desc: Single mom Juana can slice and dice anything with great speed and precision. After working at a fruit-vending cart for years, she decides to take a job at a local Japanese restaurant. Intrigued by the food, she learns to make a multitude of sushi.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: A look at top-end trains, such as South Africa's famous Blue Train, the Golden Eagle in Russia, and the Presidential Train in Portugal.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: Only the world's richest can possibly afford a super yacht, but it is not the price tag that makes these extravagant vessels exceptional, it is the luxurious details.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: Following luxury estate-agent-to-the-stars Shawn in Los Angeles, where he is on the hunt for a home for a mystery billionaire; only the best is good enough.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: A look at the business of high-end hospitality; going behind the scenes at the Kempinski Adlon in Berlin, where guests want the best food, decor and out-of-this-world service.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: Luxury travel blogger Em Sheldon catches a flight on one of the most extravagant private jets in the world, which cost more than £80m to build and kit out.

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious
programme.desc: A look at customized luxury cars; a supercar superfan, whose collection includes one of only 100 Aston Martin Vantages in the world, as well as Mercedes and Audi and three Morgans.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George is in Dorset at the UK's most exquisite example of Italianate architecture - Kingston Lacy.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George visits 1000-year-old Dunster Castle in Somerset and discovers that it's not size that matters at the finest surviving 17th-century water gardens, Westbury Court in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George visits one of the most modern Victorian houses in existence - the water-powered, cliff-top mansion Cragside in Northumberland, and explores the Grade I listed Cliveden Gardens in Maidenhead.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George visits the magnificent and meticulously-crafted country retreat - Standen in West Sussex, and discovers a masterpiece of Gothic Revival architecture at Tyntesfield in Somerset.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George discovers one of the National Trust's quirkiest buildings - a bear hut on the 6400-acre Killerton estate in Devon.

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George explores one of Britain's grandest 17th-century powerhouses - the decadent Ham House - and gets a private tour at the modernist Hampstead home of architect Ernö Goldfinger.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: In Cornwall, Richard and Sarah attempt to convert a Victorian Grade II listed bank into a home.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: George meets a Staffordshire couple who are transforming a derelict 19th century coach house into a multigenerational home; however, it may not be to the tastes of the entire family.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Rachel and Mike are transforming a former police station in West Yorkshire into a spectacular home; they need to figure out just how to convert a barred cell into a luxury bathroom.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: George meets newly-weds and first-time renovators Erin and Oliver, who are taking on the project of turning their 200-year-old, dung-filled barn near Harrogate into a stunning country home.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Gordon and Lisa are fulfilling Gordon's late mother's dream of transforming their 120-year-old cattle shed and milking parlour into their first home together.

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: In Hessle, George meets Bernie, whose daughter and son-in-law saw the potential in a ramshackle stable at the end of their garden for the perfect retirement retreat.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke sets out to discover the rules for installing a kitchen in a period home.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: A dish of crabmeat, wine and garlic.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea

programme.desc: A special dish for the Royal Navy of ragout with turbot and scallops.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc creates four mouth-watering chocolate recipes: a simple mousse, rich chocolate delice, fondant with a melting middle, and his signature dessert: cafe creme, which is a chocolate-sculpted cup filled with a mousse and coffee sabayon.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Raymond dives into the world of fish with the underused and affordable mackerel; he creates a light meal of grilled mackerel with a soy lime dressing.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc looks to the UK's favorite fruit, apples, for inspiration; he returns to memories of childhood with a simple tart made with a foolproof pastry and custard filling.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc celebrates the season with a winter vegetable salad featuring beetroots, a celeriac puree served with a crisp-skinned roast wild duck with blackberry sauce and watercress soup.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc uses two seasonal ingredients, game and mushrooms, to create a French version of a pasty called pithivier, which is filled with a rich mix of pheasant, chestnuts and dried fruits; he also makes a cep mushroom tortellini with fresh pasta.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: The miracle of yeast helps Raymond to create a French classic: brioche; he gets down to basics with a French country bread recipe that's essential for any baker to add to their repertoire; lastly, he makes a spectacular apple croustade.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond Blanc combines the universally popular ingredients of egg and cheese to make a classic omelette with a secret technique; he then uses a Comte from his home region in France to make a family-style souffle.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc focuses on tomatoes, opening with a simple salad recipe inspired by his mother; he also makes a creamy risotto, stuffed tomatoes glazed with cheese and a series of ices and sorbets to cleanse the palate with elegance.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc celebrates the best of British shellfish as he cooks dishes including Moules Mariniere, seared squid salad and Scottish lobster.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond begins with a feather-light lemon tea cake, coated in an apricot jam and tangy lemon glaze; he also makes a choux pastry filled with chocolate cream and covered with a chocolate icing; lastly, the secrets to the perfect macarons.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Blanc shares his favorite lamb dishes: lamb liver with caramelized potatoes and French seasoning, a slow-roasted garlic and herb lamb shoulder with potato and turnip gratin and lamb provencal with ratatouille.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Raymond celebrates his passion for puddings, cooking dishes including riz au lait, tarte tatin and fruit crumble.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Chef Raymond shares his love of charcuterie, beginning with thin slices of duck cured in herbs and juniper berries; also, he makes a chicken liver parfait and a meaty pot-au-feu medley; lastly, a ham hock terrine served with home-made pickles.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Kitchen Secrets
programme.desc: Drawing upon his travels through Asia, Raymond creates dishes full of fragrant spice and fiery heat.

programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.desc: The competition begins with the first heat, with new robots and some familiar faces as teams get a feel for the arena and size up their competition.

programme.title: MechMania

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: It is the last chance for teams to secure a spot before the final as they clash in one-on-one matches for a place in the top 16. New robots join the fray, hoping for a last-minute victory to advance to the championship.

programme.title: MechMania
programme.desc: The most battle-hardened combat robots in the UK compete in the MechMania Grand Final. After three heats, the tournament switches to a one-on-one sudden-death format until one team emerges as the victor.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: The House Of The Lost On The Cape [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house overlooking the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: Bleach: Fade to Black
programme.desc: Ichigo must fight a lonely battle to save Rukia before the two are forced to part ways forever!

programme.title: Demon City Shinjuku
programme.desc: A young warrior battles against a city overtaken by demons, one devil at a time. To save Tokyo from evil, he must defeat a sinister psychic from the underworld.

programme.title: Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie
programme.desc: Based on the legendary video game series. This anime classic follows Ryu, a talented fighter who may be the greatest in all of the world, and Bison, the evil mastermind searching for Ryu's talents.

programme.title: City Hunter: Goodbye My Sweetheart
programme.desc: When a mysterious soldier called The Professor seeks vengeance on the government, he demands to be paid an exorbitant ransom --or else Tokyo gets blown to smithereens. Only City Hunter (Ryo Saeba) stands a chance of stopping him from wiping out the city.

programme.title: City Hunter: Death of the Vicious Criminal Ryo Saeba
programme.desc: City Hunter, Ryo Saeba, after months of idleness, finally scores a client and it is none other than the beautiful Mega City TV newscaster, Sayaka, who fears for her life.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura 5: The Final Chapter
programme.desc: Lupa, yet another one of Lum's fiancés, arrives on the scene, and Lum and Ataru have to repeat their game of tag in order to prevent the Earth from being destroyed.

programme.title: Tetsujin 28: Morning Moon of Midday
programme.desc: Dr. Haneda was developing experimental giant robot warriors to fight the Allies during the Second World War, but before his creations could see action, Allied bombs destroyed the facility and killed him.

programme.title: Fortune Favors Lady Nikuko
programme.desc: The story of a mother and daughter and their lives aboard a boat in a fishing town.

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it. Feat: Mel Gibson.

programme.title: Open Water: Open Water
programme.desc: When a couple is stranded while scuba diving, they soon realize they are in the middle of shark-infested waters in this intense, critically acclaimed thriller.

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: My All American
programme.desc: Freddie Steinmark, an underdog on the gridiron, faces the toughest challenge of his life after leading his team to a championship season.

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, a high-priced and ruthless jury "consultant" will stop at nothing to secure a verdict on an explosive trial.

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: A man discovers that he possesses the ability to instantly teleport anywhere in the world.

programme.title: The Final Cut
programme.desc: Robin Williams, Mira Sorvino, and Jim Caviezel give dynamic performances in this mind-blowing thriller about the dark side of futuristic technology.

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Two young people are entangled in the ongoing battle between good and evil.

programme.title: Adventures Of The Wilderness Family
programme.desc: The story of a modern-day family who became bored with the hassles of the city life in Los Angeles and moved to the Rocky Mountains, never to return.

programme.title: Windstorm
programme.desc: Rebel teen Mika encounters a beautiful, wild stallion named Windstorm at her grandmother's riding school and learns she can communicate with horses.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think she’s a witch.

programme.title: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie
programme.desc: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie is ‘Babe’ meets ‘Marley and Me’ - a cheeky and downright hilarious animal adventure for the whole family! Oh and by the way… there are songs too!

programme.title: Heaven Must Wait
programme.desc: An American inherits an old village church in England, where treasure is buried. Greedy Mr. Slee scents his opportunity to snatch the treasure. Diggity, a little cherub trying to earn his wings, helps uncover the treasure for the benefit of the village.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: The Adventurer: Curse of the Midas Box
programme.desc: Transporting you to a rambunctious realm of enchanting fantasy. When Mariah's little brother is kidnapped, he follows a trail of clues to discover a hidden realm of monsters, ancient secrets and a long-lost artefact. Feat: Michael Sheen & Sam Neill.

programme.title: Not to Forget
programme.desc: After a life of little scams, a self-centered millennial is sentenced to take care of his grandmother, who is affected by Alzheimer's. As he realizes the extent of her wealth, the protagonist gets closer to the treasure he's been looking for.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: The Adventures of Greyfriars Bobby
programme.desc: Bobby, a brave Skye Terrier, becomes a local legend when he refuses to leave his master's grave after he dies. Based on true events.

programme.title: The Lost Medallion
programme.desc: Billy Stone and Allie, two 13-year-old friends, uncover a long-lost medallion and accidentally wish themselves back in time. In order for Billy to save Allie's life, he must give up the medallion to the evil warlord, Cobra, who rules the island.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Size Matters
programme.desc: Meet Kevin and the Christina, a boat that gets its own real-life fish story when it snags an 1,100-pound \\"monstah\\" right out of the gate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mann gegen Sturm
programme.desc: Marciano, captain of Hard Merchandise, risks the elements to hook a giant bluefin and finds himself with boat trouble in the midst of the storm.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mutiny at Sea
programme.desc: A mixture of bad luck and mutiny brews in this tumultuous episode of Wicked Tuna. Tensions erupt on New England's top tuna boat, Tuna.Com, when Captain Dave and Paul get into a heated confrontation that causes Paul to quit!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Grudge Match
programme.desc: With just two weeks left until the end of tuna fishing season, Bounty Hunter gains a new deckhand.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Ralph in Not
programme.desc: A hard season with little money to show has taken its toll on the crew of the Odysea, leading Captain Ralph to lash out at his first mate Pirate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Good to the Last Bite
programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Back In The Hunt
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, head for open seas in hopes of catching the first fish of the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Fish!
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for the elusive and lucrative giant Bluefin tuna, with harpooners going up against rod-and-reelers.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Numbers War
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester battle for prime fishing spots in their quest to catch the elusive and lucrative Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Fish Fight
programme.desc: For the tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, it's tournament time, and, with a big cash prize up for grabs, the fight is on to catch the biggest bluefin.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Shark Attack
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, are facing a dangerous new foe, with great white sharks swarming into local waters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sweet Smell of Revenge
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle droves of bumbling amateur fishermen in their bid to catch lucrative Atlantic Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Hell On The High Seas
programme.desc: It is week eight of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, and cracks are starting to show in the Gloucester fleet, with captains and crews pushing each other to the limit.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Meltdown
programme.desc: Tensions reach their breaking point amongst the Gloucester fleet as captains, mates and vessels fall apart.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Carnage
programme.desc: It's a battle of wills on the North Atlantic, as two of Gloucester's top Bluefin fishermen - friends-turned-foes Paul Hebert and Dave Carraro - go head-to-head to out-fish each other.

programme.desc: While spending the summer in cottage country on the shores of Lake Superior, three teens cope with boredom by testing the limits of their experience.

programme.title: Maudie
programme.desc: Based on a true story, Maudie follows the unlikely romance between Canadian folk artist Maud Lewis (Sally Hawkins) and reclusive fishmonger Everett Lewis (Ethan Hawke).

programme.desc: An aging woman questions her life after suspecting her husband is having an affair.

programme.title: Firecrackers
programme.desc: Two best friends’ plan to escape their destitute town becomes derailed when the consequences of a night of debauchery begins to dismantle their friendship and threatens their chance at freedom._x000D_

programme.title: What Maisie Knew
programme.desc: In New York City, a young girl is caught in the middle of her parents' bitter custody battle. Starring Julianne Moore, Steve Coogan, and Alexander Skarsgård.

programme.title: Naked Singularity
programme.desc: An idealistic young New York City public defender burned out by the system, on the brink of disbarment, and seeing signs of the universe collapsing all around him decides to rob a $75 million drug deal of one of his clients.

programme.title: Best of Enemies, The
programme.desc: THE BEST OF ENEMIES centers on the unlikely relationship between Ann Atwater, an outspoken civil rights activist, and C.P. Ellis, a local Ku Klux Klan leader who reluctantly co-chaired a community summit.

programme.title: Make Up
programme.desc: On a remote holiday park in Cornwall, a young woman is drawn into a mysterious obsession when she suspects her boyfriend has cheated on her._x000D_

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: When 7-year-old Albert's mother is suddenly killed in an auto accident, he and his imaginary French friend "Bogus" take up residence with his no-nonsense aunt Harriet.

programme.title: Night Raiders
programme.desc: A mother joins an underground band of vigilantes to try and rescue her daughter from a state-run institution.

programme.title: Beeba Boys
programme.desc: A ruthless mobster leads his soldiers into a turf war for control of the Vancouver drug and arms trafficking rackets.

A young woman comes to in a roadside diner with no idea where she is or how she got there. Split between two timelines, she gets taken on a violent journey as she seeks out the person responsible for her lover's death.

programme.title: Beeba Boys
programme.desc: A ruthless mobster leads his soldiers into a turf war for control of the Vancouver drug and arms trafficking rackets.

A young woman comes to in a roadside diner with no idea where she is or how she got there. Split between two timelines, she gets taken on a violent journey as she seeks out the person responsible for her lover's death.

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A former CIA (Bruce Willis) operative is kidnapped by a group of terrorist. When his son (Kellen Lutz) learns there is no plan for his father to be saved, he launches his own rescue operation.

programme.title: Alien Hunter
programme.desc: In this sci-fi thriller, extraterrestrial and cryptology expert Julien Rome (Emmy winner James Spader) is brought in to investigate a mysterious alien object in Antarctica.

programme.title: Asher
programme.desc: Asher is a former Mossad member turned gun for hire, living an austere life in an ever changing Brooklyn. In an effort to live a life before it’s too late he must kill the man he was, for a last chance at becoming the man he wants to be.

programme.title: Beyond The Reach
programme.desc: A high-rolling corporate shark and his impoverished young guide play the most dangerous game during a hunting trip in the Mojave Desert.

programme.title: Good People
programme.desc: A debt-ridden couple (James Franco, Kate Hudson) take the cash they found in a dead tenant's apartment, then become the quarry of the thief who originally stole it.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A carefree travel writer is forced to take a job as editor of a bridal magazine after a family emergency. Can the commitment-phobic party girl adapt to her new life filled with wedding dresses and romance?

programme.title: White Coats aka Intern Academy
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd ("The Blues Brothers") stars in this comedy about the madcap misadventures of a group of medical school interns.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A carefree travel writer is forced to take a job as editor of a bridal magazine after a family emergency. Can the commitment-phobic party girl adapt to her new life filled with wedding dresses and romance?

programme.title: White Coats aka Intern Academy
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd ("The Blues Brothers") stars in this comedy about the madcap misadventures of a group of medical school interns.

programme.title: Freddy Got Fingered
programme.desc: A man is forced to move back in with his parent's and then refuses to leave.

programme.title: Mercenaries
programme.desc: When a visiting dignitary is captured and imprisoned while touring a war zone, a team of elite female commandoes is assembled to infiltrate the women's prison and rescue her.

programme.title: Jurassic School
programme.desc: Nerdy middle schooler Tommy takes care of a baby dinosaur after his cloned science fair project hatches early. When the dino escapes on fair day, Tommy must figure out a way to get the creature back before greedy grown-ups get to the dinosaur first.

programme.title: Mozart and the Whale
programme.desc: Starring Josh Hartnett and Radha Mitchell, this heartwarming romantic drama is inspired by the true story of two people with Asperger's syndrome, whose emotional dysfunctions threaten to sabotage their budding romance.

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen
programme.desc: Nadine has problems with her mother and brother and considers her father as her only ally. However, things take a turn for worse for her when her best friend, Krista, starts dating her brother.

programme.title: Baby Bootcamp
programme.desc: When super cute fitness instructor Julia Penman turns thirty with no husband prospect in sight, she vows to start a family of her own – with or without a man.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Mum's the Word
programme.desc: Abby Knight, a former lawyer turned proud flower shop owner, is starting over after the death of her husband with the support from her father, a new business and her daughter off to college.

programme.title: Unexpected Grace
programme.desc: When lonely young Grace finds a note from a schoolgirl looking for a friend, she excitedly writes back, setting off a chain of events that ultimately changes the lives of three people.

programme.title: Game of Love
programme.desc: Audrey, a creative board game designer and Matthew, a research-driven marketing consultant, are tasked with creating a new game to help players find romance.

programme.title: Cooking with Love
programme.desc: Hardworking and optimistic television producer, Kelly, doesn't have time for love. Along with her mentor Amanda, Kelly dives into another season of the Little Gourmet, a kids cooking show.

programme.title: Royal Nanny
programme.desc: MI5 agent Claire goes undercover as the royal nanny, and must overcome the challenges of her assignment, like resisting the charms of Prince Colin while keeping the family safe at Christmas.

programme.title: Mid-Love Crisis
programme.desc: On the eve of turning 50 and her daughters' nuptials, Mindy Quinn finds herself doing the most unexpected thing: rekindling a romance that ended thirty years ago.

programme.title: Tulips in Spring
programme.desc: An interior designer must halt her work on a big project in order to return home and assist her injured father at her family's tulip farm in rural Washington state.

programme.title: The Wedding Contract
programme.desc: Rebecca, a teacher, and Adam, an ad executive are excited to plan their Jewish wedding, but their wedding and future are put into jeopardy when Adam lands a new ad campaign, and their mothers meet.

programme.title: Royal Nanny
programme.desc: MI5 agent Claire goes undercover as the royal nanny, and must overcome the challenges of her assignment, like resisting the charms of Prince Colin while keeping the family safe at Christmas.

programme.title: Love is a Piece of Cake
programme.desc: Jessie Dale is a third generation baker who loves her cake shop more than anything in the world. When developers threaten to buy her building and force her out, she must do all she can to save her bakery.

programme.title: A Homecoming for the Holidays
programme.desc: Country singer Charlotte is home for the holidays and brother Ryan's fellow ex-soldier Matt is in town. Writing her new album, Charlotte works with Matt to build a house for a friend in town.

programme.title: Three Wise Men and a Baby
programme.desc: Three brothers get the surprise of their lives when they are forced to work together and care for a baby over the holidays.

programme.title: Inventing the Christmas Prince
programme.desc: Shelby is about to quit her job as a rocket engineer when her daughter becomes convinced that her Scrooge-like boss, Evan, is the Christmas Prince; a story Shelby invented years ago.

programme.title: My Grown Up Christmas List
programme.desc: Taylor and Luke have a special bond that grows between them after several Christmases spent together and apart.

programme.title: A Glenbrooke Christmas
programme.desc: Longing to be accepted for herself and not just her wealth, an heiress heads to the small town of Glenbrooke, where she discovers the joys of a simple Christmas, community, and maybe even love.

programme.title: All Saints Christmas
programme.desc: Lisette is a popular R&B singer who’s getting ready to travel home to New Orleans for Christmas.

programme.title: Ghosts of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Ellie is told by a fortune teller that she must resolve her past and make amends with all of those she ghosted before Christmas and discovers love in the process.

programme.title: Cranberry Christmas
programme.desc: A separated couple feign marital bliss on national television to help their town's Christmas festival - and their business. But what will be when rekindled love is complicated by new opportunities?

programme.title: Debbie Macomber's A Mrs. Miracle Christmas
programme.desc: When a family faces loneliness and loss of faith, Mrs. Miracle swoops in to renew their Christmas Spirit, and they experience a holiday of heavenly proportions.

programme.title: Christmas Class Reunion
programme.desc: Valedictorian Elle is determined to host a perfect 15-year high school reunion. She's looking forward to seeing her high school crush Kam, but she finds unexpected support in bad boy Devin.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: A super-sleuth bishop investigates a suspicious insurance business; an elderly couple construct a house that has no walls.

programme.title: Survivorman: Beyond Survival
programme.desc: Les Stroud goes into open waters with the Sea Gypsies of Malaysia to spearfish in shark-filled seas; survive in a world of water, where storms and tsunamis threaten to wipe out the tribe.

programme.title: Dangerous
programme.desc: An ex-con and reformed sociopath battles a band of heavily armed mercenaries as he tries to uncover the truth behind his brother's mysterious death.

programme.title: Meatballs
programme.desc: A zany summer camp counselor leads his misfit charges into a no-holds-barred competition against high-class campers.

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A mentally unhinged yuppie (Christian Bale) in 1980s New York submits to an uncontrollable bloodlust.

programme.title: Barney's Version
programme.desc: A detective's book prompts a thrice-married TV producer (Paul Giamatti) to revisit events surrounding his best friend's long-ago disappearance.

programme.title: Crash
programme.desc: Racial tensions collide in a collection of intertwined stories involving residents of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Chaplin
programme.desc: From London poverty to Hollywood legend, silent-film star Charlie Chaplin's (Robert Downey Jr.) life story is told.

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: A swindler falls in love with the eccentric heiress he and his brother have chosen as their final mark before quitting con games.

programme.title: Knowing
programme.desc: A professor (Nicolas Cage) and his son obtain an encoded time-capsule document that lists every major disaster over the past 50 years and predicts a future global calamity.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new special episode of Ridiculousness, dedicated to the smart people who make our world a better place, Rob, Steelo and Chanel take a look at some lesser-known NERDACHIEVEMENTS, the dark side of science, with TRIAL AND TERROR

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On a special episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling and Chanel get down with the bros as they view the world in BRO-MOTION, learn what it means to be BRO-PROOF, and study the special bro bond IN BRO WE TRUST.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Steelo and Chanel get dodge ball damaged in RUBBER STAMPED, become masters of disguise with BLENDERS, and get too honest dropping TRUTH BOMBS

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness singer/songwriter/producer Mike Posner joins Rob, Steelo and Chanel to take TOO MANY PILLS, explore some BROMANTIC BONDS and learn about WHITE GIRL PROBLEMS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Laker shooting guard Jordan Clarkson joins Rob, Steelo and Chanel to throw down some JAMMIES, check out the TONGUE CAM and experience some water pain in the category GETTIN' LAKED.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper Waka Flocka Flame joins Rob, Chanel and Sterling to consider hiring some QUALIFIED ROLLERS, marvel at people who use NO HANDS, and laugh at CRAPTICAL JOKERS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper Waka Flocka Flame joins Rob, Chanel and Sterling to consider hiring some QUALIFIED ROLLERS, marvel at people who use NO HANDS, and laugh at CRAPTICAL JOKERS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new special episode of Ridiculousness dedicated to the world of weed, Rob, Steelo and Chanel check out some ANIMALS IN PANTS, explore what it's like to have BONG BRAIN and ask themselves the question AM I HIGH?

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness the 80's are back with Rockdiculousness! Steel Panther joins Rob, Chanel and Sterling to fire up the FLAME FUEL, grab some COMMUNITY PROPERTY and tempt death with LIVIN' ON A PRAYER.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new special episode of Ridiculousness, we celebrate the world of NASCAR, with a salute to PASS MASTERS, an introduction to NASCAR EXITS, and a look at what happens when people get PAVEMENTAL.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Steelo, and Chanel are joined by country musician Wheeler Walker, Jr. to discuss his BANNED MATES, analyze grooming techniques in MUFF MAINTENANCE, and explore the embarrassment of PREMATURE RELEASES.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness Rob, Steelo and Chanel are joined by actor Matt Shively to experience some PARANORM-ISH ACTIVITY, do some ATTEMPTED MAN SHIT and meet some animals that are MILK READY.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Laugh along with Rob, Steelo, and Chanel as they break down hilarious Redneck Good Times, Nutflix, and Double Whammies. Guest Ryan O'Malley, a professional pogo sticker, shows the highs and lows of being Pogo Stuck.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Movie Star Johnny Knoxville helps Rob break down Makeshift Ramps, Freak Beasts, and Poorly Placed Kids. Learn why you're Never too Old to Slam and why birds are not your friend.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob's former co-star Big Black joins the panel, breaking down Makeshift Thrill Rides, Bieber Hair, and Coming in Hot. See how human scorpions sting in a whole different way than the spider that attacks an innocent dad.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Action sports star Travis Pastrana helps Rob illustrate some Poorly Placed Trees and Whiskey Throttles. Rob breaks down Pastranabees and Animals Being Human. Explode with laughter at an ill-fated Butt Bottle Rocket.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Action sports personality The Dingo joins Rob in breaking down Pain Angels, Worst Case Scenarios and things That'll Cost You. And you'll never guess what happens when a heavy lifter loses control.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Steelo, and Chanel laugh till it hurts at Unnecessary Combos, people who should Stay out of the water, and others who just plain wonder Who Put That There? Karate expert Matthew Mounce helps break down some Bad Karate.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Producer Jeff Tremaine joins Rob in breaking down what it means to Lawnchair and Slam and Sprint. Some kids start slamming young in Ridiculousness in Training, and Rob points out Your Friend's a Dick.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Beauty Queen Caite Upton joins Steelo on the panel. Rob breaks down the magic of Man-kinis and Dodging Bullets. Guest Matt Schlager demonstrates how to fall with your face first and hands second, in Getting Schlagered.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob's cousin Drama helps Rob break down Family Dysfunction, Your Friend's a Dick, and Little Rollers. Credit Cards compete for pain against Popsicles. And learn whether Parkour is an art or just some Aggressive Running.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Bull rider Judd Leffew schools Chanel on whether bulls get dizzy when Rob breaks down A Bunch of Bull and Angry Animals. Watch fools compete in the Ridiculousness Decathlon. And a whole lot of people get Dunked.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Caite Upton joins Steelo once again as Rob shows off S**t Whips and Redneck Good Times. A lot of people blow out their money-makers in De-Faced. Biker Fox joins the panel for some fun in spandex and scrapes in Biker Down.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: TV star Ryan Dunn joins the fun as Rob points out the problems with Lower Education. See some folks who are clearly Out of Your League while others get slammed in That's What You Get and Let Me Help You Hurt Yourself.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob breaks down Why Rollerblading Should Make a Comeback. Witness a merry-go-round of pain in Worst Case Scenario, Almost Made It and Not Even Close. And guest unicyclist Dan Heaton shows off some Uni-Psychos.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Learn How Not to Treadmill and why Grass is Your Friend. See a wake of damage after Trees Strike Back. Guest dancer Cole Hernandez brings some Weird Dancing. Some skaters get Racked. Rob narrates Chicken Police.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: The Dingo is back! Laugh as a whole lot of people have a Tough Day on the Job, find out if You're Too Old For That, and who's Almost Awesome. Rob breaks down Skiers vs. Snowboarders. Shoes go flying off in Shoe Down.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Big Black is back and he's showing off Black Lavender. See what happens When Bad Ideas Go Worse and people suffer a Failure to Launch. Rob's got a special category that only comes once: You Couldn't Do That Again if you Tried.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Justin Bieber stops by the set to show off some of his Canadian pride, learn about Humanimals and what Popcorning is really all about.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Floyd Mayweather visits the Ridiculousness studio where Rob shows him what a Pain Face looks like. They'll also endure some Romantic Injuries and learn How Not To Train.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Former "PMOY", Sara Jean Underwood, visits the Ridiculousness set where Rob shows off his Fear Face and they talk about how Cats are Weird.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: UFC fighter & former champion, Quinton "Rampage" Jackson, shows his wolf battle cry and what really sets off his Hot Button. Rob also shows videos of Crappy Endings and what it's like to get Slampaged.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Ace of Cakes star chef, Duff Goldman, stops by set with a scorpion cake and we see some of his Unnecessary Costumes. He and Rob also show videos of Grand Entrances and Ghost Holes.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Australian-born actor and radio personality, Jason Ellis, shows us he is an expert at Showing Off Gone Wrong when the introduction of Tramp Stamp videos earns him a surprise payback from Chanel.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob and co-hosts, Chanel and Sterling, breakdown the fun of Redneck Good Times and introduce new categories: Random Tackles, Animal Revenge, Dropping Loads, and many more.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob dedicates Whisky Throttle and Bear Trap videos to Nitro Circus stunt man, Streetbike Tommy. Tommy also tells us why you should always Bring Your Own Chair.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Lil Jon and Rob enjoy the "Yeah" category inspired by the rapper, watch videos of Dancing Animals, unintentional Body Shots, and people getting Fenced.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Tyler, the Creator and Loiter Squad co-star, Taco, visit the set of Ridiculousness and learn about Sloppy Finishes and Faceballs.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Wiz Khalifa - Rapper, Wiz Khalifa, guest stars where he'll discuss with Rob why Grass Is Your Friend and the joys of Human Magnets. The fan-favorite, Makeshift Thrill Rides, returns to the show.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Actress and musical artist, Kat Graham, shows us some of her big moments of One-Liners and how to dance on stage with one shoe. Rob also shows videos of her Magical Spells.

programme.title: Animal Homes
programme.desc: Everyone needs a place to live, but some aren't happy with the great outdoors, they look for some home comforts - they use extraordinary specialist building skills to construct the perfect home. Homes have many uses. They can prove a bolthole to escape predators, a safe nursery in which to raise young, a food store and a shelter from bad weather.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 1
programme.desc: Winter means more than just the beginning of the year for the people of Lofoten: For more than a thousand years, Lofoten has been a hub for cod fishing, with seasons lasting from February to April as huge shoals migrate from the Barents Sea to these waters. During these hectic months, more than 65,000 tons of fish are brought to shore, securing the income for the whole of Lofoten for years to come. Around a quarter of the fish caught ends up on lines to dry upon racks. From a young age, the children from the fishing villages get to earn some pocket money by cutting cod tongues and selling the produce as a delicacy appreciated by the locals.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 2
programme.desc: Almost unnoticeably, spring turns into summer. The days become longer and longer, with a never-setting sun. People who have spent their winter and spring working hard can finally enjoy their own nature, even though the temperature is only slightly warmer. Lofoten is sparsely populated, just 24,000 people live here. Unstad is one of its smallest communities with only 15 inhabitants, but despite that, it has become a hotspot for arctic surf and is host to the northern-most surf center in the world. Surfers from all over the globe come to surf in the arctic water.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de Valensole”, our viewers encounter Gérard Blanc, who has been hit particularly hard. The lavender farmer lost sixty percent of his harvest to one tiny insect: the leafhopper. This insect has already destroyed half of the lavender acreage, bumping France from its market position as the world’s top producer of lavender oil. The film visits a resolute farmer who, not about to give up, is testing methods to fend off the voracious insect.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The progress of first cultivation attempts is slow. In India, the rural population, especially, needs affordable, well-tolerated medicine – medicine based on herbs. In Kerala, the film shows a family operation that hand-produces botanical medicine for the local market. High up in the Himalayas, we observe a village healer at work. The science of Ayurvedic medicine is five thousand years old. Today, interest in the ancient healing art is surging, not only in India. In Delhi’s Old Town, the film visits a wholesaler who supplies the booming global herb market, and we take a look inside the laboratories of the largest manufacturer of Ayurvedic medicines in the world. In Kerala, we meet a doctor employed at a small Ayurveda clinic, and in Nordern India, we join a student of Tibetan medicine on a hike up into the mountains, where she prepares for an exam in herbology.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on preserving this invaluable knowledge.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian distillery in Germany, Hubsi digs for protected gentian roots in Berchtesgaden National Park. For yellow gentian is one of the most bitter medicinal herbs in the world, well suited for schnapps and as a general tonic.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for entering and exiting the narrow blossom is strenuous. Within three weeks, maximum, Mladen must remove his bees from the island. Otherwise they will die of exhaustion. In Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, the film visits Iva Yosifova. Hollyhock provides the raw material for her objects of art. The herb is medically beneficial, due to its mucilage, which is added to many cough tea mixtures. Iva, though, makes paper from hollyhock. Thanks to the herb’s long fibres, the paper can be spread onto objects and modeled. The technique produces delicate sculptures, as fragile as nature.

programme.title: Aurora - Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: In the earth’s polar regions, a ghostly flicker and colourful glow often brighten the night sky. Whoever sees an aurora event will never forget this impressive experience. Finland’s Saami people, Alaska’s Inuit, Canada’s Native Americans and New Zealand’s Maori all have legends about the origins and meaning of this magic natural spectacle. These stories tell of spirits dancing in the sky, of a bright and better world where hunting game is abundant, of battling gods and celestial messages.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrow's generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrow's generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Gironde is the largest and most powerful tidal current in Europe. When the Gironde flows into the Atlantic, it is 15 kilometers wide and in the rhythm of the tides, it brings the waters from the Pyrenees and the Massif Central into the ocean. This often pushes its waters far out into the Gironde at high tide.This creates a world of its own that has shaped everything uniquely and intensely for tens of thousands of years. The water surface of the river is so large that the evaporation has created its own microclimate, which is stable and, together with the brackish waters, has influenced flora and fauna on the right and left of the bank for a long time.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Dordogne consists of a visible and an invisible system of flowing water. Caves and basins under the earth's surface store the excess water and return it to the river when it is dry. A perfect management of a precious resource, not invented by humans, but by the complex nature itself. The result is an ever life-giving river.
